Near there, the capsule (its a capsule, not a pod =) starts opening 
because the coolant system could not keep up. The robot inside is in 
passive mode, but he could go offline anytime soon...

--- In nbwrpg@y..., dewboy30816@y... wrote:
> If you want me to save him o.k. but Rhesus stays.
> 
> Mustex Stallex and Rhesus:
> 
> They pick up the distress signal.
> 
> Mustex:  What the... a stasis pod.  Rhesus well go investigate.  You 
> stay here.  If we end up with an enemy on our hand we'll need those 
> cannons.  But if he's friend we can't just let him go offline.  
Mustex 
> and Stallex climb onto their hover-cycles and take off at there 
> estimate of the landing position.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., wingedwarrior41@h... wrote:
> > OOC: Far from that!
> > 
> > BIC: A capsule that had been deriving since a long time in space 
was 
> > entering earth's orbit. It was an old capsule, about from the 
Great 
> > War. It entered the atmosphere, fire surrounding it. It went down 
> > about in central africa. The robot inside was still alive, but the 
> > energy would be out in just a few cycle. The capsule's computer 
sent 
> > out a distress signal.
